rdf:Description.dc:creator: 06RT9
rdf:Description.dc:title: TOWED BODY ON AIRCRAFT - Install Procedure
rdf:Description.dc:subject: TOWED BODY ON AIRCRAFT - Install Procedure

description.para: NOTE—Ensure AN/ALQ-223 Sensor Deployment System (CSTRS) is in the full-up position prior to positioning towed body under CSTRS.

listItem.para: Position towed body immediately aft of CSTRS.
Ensure power to aircraft electrical and hydraulic systems is secured.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: WARNING—Wear leather gloves when handling tow cable to prevent personnel injury due to broken wire strands in tow cable.

listItem.para: Remove tow cable electrical connector protective cover.
Inspect tow cable electrical/fiber-optic connection for damage and corrosion. If corrosion is noted, clean and treat IAW NA 01-1A-509.
Clean electrical connector and fiber-optic points on wet end of tow cable using isopropyl alcohol. Allow electrical connector to dry.
Remove and discard O-ring from inside tow cable electrical connector using brass O-ring removal tool.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: CAUTION—Use caution not to scratch electrical connector O-ring mating surfaces during O-ring removal.

listItem.para: Clean O-ring groove, fiber-optic points, and contact areas on tow cable electrical connector with isopropyl alcohol. Allow electrical connector to dry.
Apply O-ring lubricant to new O-ring and install into groove in tow cable electrical connector. Look through electrical connector inspection slot to verify proper seating of O-ring.
Reinstall tow cable electrical connector protective cover.

description.para: CAUTION—When installing new lubricated O-ring into tow cable electrical connector, use caution not to contaminate electrical connector fiber-optic points and contact areas with lubricant.
NOTE—Center wing fairing must be removed to facilitate tow cable attachment.

listItem.para: Loosen screws that secure center wing fairing, and remove fairing.
If installed, remove towed body hull penetration electrical connector protective cover, and inspect electrical connector for damage or corrosion. Clean and treat IAW NA 01-1A-509.
Remove and discard O-ring located inside hull penetration electrical connector using brass O-ring removal tool.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: CAUTION—Use caution not to scratch electrical connector O-ring mating surfaces during O-ring removal.

listItem.para: Clean hull penetration electrical connector O-ring groove, fiber-optic points, and contact areas with isopropyl alcohol. Allow hull penetration electrical connector to dry.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: CAUTION—When installing new lubricated O-ring into hull penetration electrical connector, use caution not to contaminate electrical connector fiber-optic points and contact areas with lubricant.

listItem.para: Apply O-ring lubricant to new O-ring and install into groove in hull penetration electrical connector. Use inspection mirror to verify proper seating of O-ring.
Ensure the Conductivity,

description.para: Temperature, and Depth (CTD) sensor and compass electrical cables are connected and secure.

listItem.para: Pass the tow cable wet end through center wing fairing.
Remove tow cable electrical connector protective cover.
Align keyway of tow cable electrical

caution.warningAndCautionPara: CAUTION—Use extreme care when connecting tow cable wet end electrical connector to towed body hull penetration connector to prevent twisting or dislodging the O-rings causing saltwater intrusion.

CAUTION—Ensure tow cable fairing is oriented so that fairing leading edge is facing towards forward end of towed body. Damage to tow cable fairing will result if fairing is not properly oriented prior to loading towed body on aircraft.

description.para: on towed body, and make connection.

listItem.para: Insert flanged bushings into the towed body tow-point clevis assembly with the flange toward the inside of the assembly.
Apply thread-locking compound to the threads of threaded bushings.
Thread bushings into the tow cable termination point with the flange toward the outside of the tow cable termination point (if applicable).
Using the OAMCM shear pin torque wrench adapter, torque bushings to
Place cable bushing into tow point.
Situate tow cable and ground wire so that they lie in center of towed body tow point clevis. Ultimately, tow cable and ground wire will sit below shear pin after shear pin is installed.
Verify tow cable fairing leading edge is still facing towards forward end of towed body.
With tow cable fairing facing towards forward end of towed body, position tow cable termination point into towed body tow point clevis.

description.para: NOTE—Take care not to drop the shear pin. Even minor damage may prevent the shear pin from inserting into the assembly and may affect its performance.

listItem.para: Insert shear pin through towed body tow point and tow cable termination bushings, and install the shear pin Teflon bushing.
Visually inspect to verify tow cable and ground wire are positioned in towed body tow point clevis below shear pin.
Install cotter pins at each end of shear pin.
Remove screw from towed body wing center section marked TOW CABLE GROUND.
Position tow cable ground wire on screw removed in previous step, and reinstall screw with ground wire in wing center section.
Torque screw 15 to 18 ft-lb. (QA)
Slide the wing center fairing down the tow cable into place on wing assembly, but do not secure.
Power up aircraft and common console IAW A1-H60CD-60S-000.
Energize power to towed body IAW common console section of A1-H60CD-60S-000.
Wait until automatic PUB is complete.
Initiate OIB from common console IAW common console section of A1-H60CD-60S-000 to verify towed body operational status. If OIB fails, troubleshoot towed body.
Secure wing center fairing to wing assembly using captive screws.
Position towed body under CSTRS.
Release straps that secure towed body to MHU-191/M.
Operate CSTRS winch IAW CSTRS section of A1-H60CD-60S-000 to raise and secure towed body onto CSTRS guide assembly.
